abstract: When a checking account is overdrawn, the bank can cover the shortfall (for a fee) or another account can serve as a backup (for a fee). But there are also ways to avoid overdrawing at all.
snippet: When a checking account is overdrawn, the bank can cover the shortfall (for a fee) or another account can serve as a backup (for a fee). But there are also ways to avoid overdrawing at all.
lead_paragraph: CHASE, one of the country’s largest consumer banks, is making changes to its overdraft protection service, which kicks in if customers overdraw their checking accounts.

headline.main: Protecting Your Checking Account From Overdraft Fees
headline.print_headline: Protecting Your Checking Account From Overdraft Fees
